Just chiming in here. I like the interface too, but here are the two nit-picks I have (and really, they're just nit-picks):

1. I keep looking for a "save" button at the bottom, when I'm editing the mod info. I adjust the fields in order, and end up at the bottom of the page, and then have to scroll back up to save changes.

2. The thumbnail and the banner use the same image, but have completely different aspect ratios. While we can adjust the height position of the banner, we have no control for the thumbnail. So it's really hard to make an image that looks good for both.

I like KerbalStuff a lot, and have been using it as the primary location for my mods, in that my AVC links point there, and it's the first download link on each of my mod threads.

Update: you can now make mod packs on Kerbal Stuff. This should allow people to make mod packs, but prevents problems with outdated mods and makes sure the authors get credit (as well as being convenient). Here's an example: https://kerbalstuff.com/pack/1/Interstellar%20Quest

... its a curated list of what to download, rather than a unified, single pack with compatibility tweaks meant to work together as a unit.

"Adapter" mods can usually provide the necessary customizations. Plus, this paradigm encourages modders to create better APIs so that internal modifications aren't necessary.
